title: [With proposed fix] Installation issue: expect
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install expect

Error: ProcessError: install_name_tool: No such file or directory: 'install_name_tool'
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux 5d250e13fd17 3.10.0-1062.12.1.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Feb 4 23:02:59 UTC 2020 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    CentOS Linux release 7.7.1908 (Core)
``` 

I believe that `install_name_tool` is specific to MacOS, so the entire [`darwin_fix` function](https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/develop/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/expect/package.py#L63) should look like this:
```
    @run_after('install')
    def darwin_fix(self):
        # The shared library is not installed correctly on Darwin; fix this
        if not self.spec.satisfies('platform=darwin'):
            return

        fix_darwin_install_name(
            join_path(self.prefix.lib, 'expect{0}'.format(self.version)))

        old = 'libexpect{0}.dylib'.format(self.version)
        new = glob.glob(join_path(self.prefix.lib, 'expect*', 'libexpect*'))[0]
        install_name_tool = Executable('install_name_tool')
        install_name_tool('-change', old, new, self.prefix.bin.expect)
```
